title: Ticket #3109: DAGMan and job lost over condor_off/condor_on pair.
description:
It looks like some jobs weren't restarted after (accidentally) condor_off'ing on submit-2.batlab.org. I've grabbed a copy of Condor's logs and of the run directory of a run displaying the problem and stashed them in ~tlmiller/scary-problem on that machine.

In particular: the monitor is not presently running, yet is job log (monitor.log) ends with an eviction notice, rather than a terminate or remove event. This seems to violate one of our invariants. Likewise for the DAGMan watching the monitor.

The monitor's log: 

  000 (445454.000.000) 07/02 11:34:40 Job submitted from host: <128.104.100.29:9543>
      DAG Node: monitor
  ...
  001 (445454.000.000) 07/02 11:34:41 Job executing on host: <128.104.100.29:9543>
  ...
  004 (445454.000.000) 07/03 15:12:43 Job was evicted.
          (0) Job was not checkpointed.
                  Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Remote Usage
                  Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Local Usage
          0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
          0  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
  ...

Everything in the schedd logs about it: 

  condor/SchedLog.old:07/03/12 15:12:43 (pid:23814) Sending SIGTERM to scheduler universe job 445454.0 (pid: 7408)
  condor/SchedLog.old:07/03/12 15:12:43 (pid:23814) scheduler universe job (445454.0) pid 7408 exited with status 4

And condor_q 445454.0 returns nothing.

For the corresponding DAGMan: 

  000 (445452.000.000) 07/02 11:34:25 Job submitted from host: <128.104.100.29:9543>
  ...
  001 (445452.000.000) 07/02 11:34:25 Job executing on host: <128.104.100.29:9543>
  ...
  004 (445452.000.000) 07/03 15:12:33 Job was evicted.
          (0) Job was not checkpointed.
                  Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Remote Usage
                  Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Local Usage
          0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
          0  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
  ...

and its schedd log entries: 

  condor/SchedLog.old:07/03/12 15:12:33 (pid:23814) Sending SIGTERM to scheduler universe job 445452.0 (pid: 7355)
  condor/SchedLog.old:07/03/12 15:12:33 (pid:23814) scheduler universe job (445452.0) pid 7355 exited with status 3

The schedd was trying to a graceful shutdown as a result of the accidental condor_off: 

  07/03/12 15:08:59 (pid:23814) Got SIGTERM. Performing graceful shutdown.
  07/03/12 15:38:59 (pid:23814) Got SIGQUIT.  Performing fast shutdown.

but didn't finish.
